Prep 10 m Ready In 10 m In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt. Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic. Stir in cayenne pepper. Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.

1 pound bacon ADVERTISEMENT 1 (16 ounce) package little smokie sausages ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup brown sugar, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut bacon into thirds and wrap each strip around a little sausage. Place the wrapped sausages on wooden skewers, several to a skewer. Arrange the skewers on a baking sheet and sprinkle them liberally with brown sugar. Bake until bacon is crisp and the brown sugar melted.

4 cloves garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 (10 ounce) container Alfredo-style pasta sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 30 m Ready In 1 h 15 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place garlic in a small baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven 20 to 30 minutes, until soft. Remove from heat. When cool enough to touch, squeeze softened garlic from skins. In an 8x8 inch baking dish, spread the roasted garlic, spinach, artichoke hearts, Alfredo-style pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and cream cheese. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until cheeses are melted and bubbly. Serve warm.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/265544.jpg

Prep 10 m Cook 3 m Ready In 13 m Stir together cream cheese and mayonnaise in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in green chiles and jalapeno peppers. Pour mixture into a microwave safe serving dish, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Microwave on High until hot, about 3 minutes.

1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup mayonnaise ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup grated Romano cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1 clove garlic, peeled and minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 25 m Ready In 40 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a small baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Romano cheese, garlic, basil, garlic salt, salt and pepper. Gently stir in artichoke hearts and spinach. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/779750.jpg

2 pounds lean ground beef ADVERTISEMENT 1 (46 fluid ounce) can tomato juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 (29 ounce) can tomato sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups chopped onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chili powder ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 1 h 45 m Ready In 1 h 55 m Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, and crumble. In a large pot over high heat combine the ground beef, tomato juice, tomato sauce, kidney beans, pinto beans, onions, bell pepper, cayenne pepper, sugar, oregano, ground black pepper, salt, cumin and chili powder. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer for 1 1/2 hours. (Note: If using a slow cooker, set on low, add ingredients, and cook for 8 to 10 hours.)
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/586964.jpg

Prep 10 m Cook 7 h Ready In 7 h 10 m Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker; pour the root beer over the meat. Cover and cook on low until well cooked and the pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Note: the actual length of time may vary according to individual slow cooker. Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce. Serve over hamburger buns.

1 (14 ounce) can beef broth ADVERTISEMENT 3 pounds boneless pork ribs ADVERTISEMENT 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbeque sauce ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 4 h 30 m Ready In 4 h 45 m Pour can of beef broth into slow cooker, and add boneless pork ribs. Cook on High heat for 4 hours, or until meat shreds easily. Remove meat, and shred with two forks. It will seem that it's not working right away, but it will. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Transfer the shredded pork to a Dutch oven or iron skillet, and stir in barbeque sauce. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until heated through.

1 pound bratwurst sausages, sliced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon butter ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 onion, sliced ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.5 ounce) package tortilla chips ADVERTISEMENT 1 (16 ounce) can refried beans ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons pickled jalapeno pepper slices ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon onion powder, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 40 m Ready In 1 h Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Brown the bratwurst slices in a skillet over medium heat, 10 to 12 minutes, stirring often; drain excess grease and set the sausage aside. Melt the butter with olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook the onions in the butter and oil mixture, stirring often, until soft and brown, about 20 minutes. Set aside. Spread the tortilla chips onto a baking sheet in an even layer. Spread the bratwurst slices, caramelized onions, dollops of refried beans, jalapeno pepper slices, and Mexican cheese blend over the chips. Sprinkle with chili powder, cayenne pepper, and onion powder. Bake the nachos in the preheated oven until hot and the cheese is melted, 10 to 15 minutes. Watch carefully to avoid burning.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/890638.jpg

I always prep and cook the chili the night before and then reheat the next day. This is a combination of many different tomato-based chili recipes. Good luck and enjoy." Featured in Allrecipes Magazine — Subscribe! Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

2 pounds ground beef chuck ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound bulk Italian sausage ADVERTISEMENT 3 (15 ounce) cans chili beans, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in spicy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 (28 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 large yellow onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 3 stalks celery, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 green chile peppers, seeded and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon bacon bits ADVERTISEMENT 4 cubes beef bouillon ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup beer ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™) ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon paprika ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 (10.5 ounce) bag corn chips such as Fritos® ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 2 h Ready In 2 h 30 m Heat a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Crumble the ground chuck and sausage into the hot pan, and cook until evenly browned. Drain off excess grease. Pour in the chili beans, spicy chili beans, diced tomatoes and tomato paste. Add the onion, celery, green and red bell peppers, chile peppers, bacon bits, bouillon, and beer. Season with chili powder, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, oregano, cumin, hot pepper sauce, basil, salt, pepper, cayenne, paprika, and sugar. Stir to blend, then cover and simmer over low heat for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally. After 2 hours, taste, and adjust salt, pepper, and chili powder if necessary. The longer the chili simmers, the better it will taste. Remove from heat and serve, or refrigerate, and serve the next day. To serve, ladle into bowls, and top with corn chips and shredded Cheddar cheese.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/829527.jpg

2 kiwis, peeled and diced ADVERTISEMENT 2 Golden Delicious apples - peeled, cored and diced ADVERTISEMENT 8 ounces raspberries ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound strawberries ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons fruit preserves, any flavor ADVERTISEMENT 10 (10 inch) flour tortillas ADVERTISEMENT butter flavored cooking spray ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 10 m Ready In 45 m In a large bowl, thoroughly mix kiwis, Golden Delicious apples, raspberries, strawberries, white sugar, brown sugar and fruit preserves. Cover and chill in the refrigerator at least 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat one side of each flour tortilla with butter flavored cooking spray. Cut into wedges and arrange in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle wedges with desired amount of cinnamon sugar. Spray again with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven 8 to 10 minutes. Repeat with any remaining tortilla wedges. Allow to cool approximately 15 minutes. Serve with chilled fruit mixture.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/414837.jpg

12 whole fresh mushrooms ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon onion powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 20 m Ready In 45 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel. Carefully break off stems. Chop stems extremely fine, discarding tough end of stems. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and chopped mushroom stems to the skillet. Fry until any moisture has disappeared, taking care not to burn garlic. Set aside to cool. When garlic and mushroom mixture is no longer hot, stir in cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder and cayenne pepper. Mixture should be very thick. Using a little spoon, fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing. Arrange the mushroom caps on prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mushrooms are piping hot and liquid starts to form under caps.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/2018464.jpg

1/2 cup all-purpose flour ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon paprika ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 10 chicken wings ADVERTISEMENT oil for deep frying ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup hot sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 dash ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 dash garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 15 m Ready In 2 h In a small bowl mix together the flour, paprika, cayenne pepper and salt. Place chicken wings in a large nonporous glass dish or bowl and sprinkle flour mixture over them until they are evenly coated. Cover dish or bowl and refrigerate for 60 to 90 minutes. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). The oil should be just enough to cover wings entirely, an inch or so deep. Combine the butter, hot sauce, pepper and garlic powder in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir together and heat until butter is melted and mixture is well blended. Remove from heat and reserve for serving. Fry coated wings in hot oil for 10 to 15 minutes, or until parts of wings begin to turn brown. Remove from heat, place wings in serving bowl, add hot sauce mixture and stir together. Serve.

Prep 15 m Cook 5 h Ready In 5 h 15 m Pour the vegetable oil into the bottom of a slow cooker. Place the pork roast into the slow cooker; pour in the barbecue sauce, apple cider vinegar, and chicken broth. 12 eggs ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup mayonnaise ADVERTISEMENT 4 slices bacon ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons finely shredded Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon mustard ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 10 m Ready In 40 m Place eggs in a saucepan, and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat. Cover, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, and cool. To cool more quickly, rinse eggs under cold running water. Meanwhile, place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Alternatively, wrap bacon in paper towels and cook in the microwave for about 1 minute per slice. Crumble and set aside. Peel the hard-cooked eggs, and cut in half lengthwise. Remove yolks to a small bowl. Mash egg yolks with mayonnaise, crumbled bacon and cheese. Stir in mustard. Fill egg white halves with the yolk mixture and refrigerate until serving.

2 pounds lean ground beef ADVERTISEMENT 1 (46 fluid ounce) can tomato juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 (29 ounce) can tomato sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups chopped onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup chopped celery ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups canned red beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 1 h 30 m Ready In 1 h 45 m Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside. Add all ingredients to a large kettle. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.

1 (15 ounce) can black-eyed peas ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup chopped onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 (4 ounce) can diced jalapeno peppers ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup Italian-style salad dressing ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Ready In 8 h 10 m In a medium bowl, combine black-eyed peas, black beans, corn, onion, green bell pepper, jalapeno peppers and tomatoes. Season with Italian-style salad dressing and garlic salt; mix well. Cover, and refrigerate overnight to blend flavors.
